members.prompt: What is the main difference between arrays and vectors?
members.optionA: Vectors have a fixed size, while arrays have dynamic size
members.optionB: Vectors can hold items of multiple types, while arrays cannot
members.optionC: Arrays can hold items of multiple types, while vectors cannot
members.solution: Arrays have a fixed size, while vectors have dynamic size

members.prompt: Which way to declare an array is CORRECT?
Which way to declare a vector is NOT CORRECT?

Given:

vector myVec = {1, 2, 3};

How do you add the element 5 to the end of myVec?

Given:

vector myVec = {1, 2, 3};

How do you remove the last element from myVec?
What makes a structure different from an array?
members.optionA: An array can change size, structure cannot
members.optionB: The values of structure elements can change, array values cannot
members.optionC: An array can hold mixed types, structures cannot
members.solution: Arrays hold same-type elements; structures hold mixed types.

members.prompt: What is the difference between public and private variables and functions in a class?
members.optionA: Private: cannot be changed, public: can be changed
members.optionB: Public: known to the user, private: secret
members.optionC: Private: only access outside class, public: can change outside class
members.solution: Private: access inside class. Public: access/change outside class

members.prompt: What does the Regex command ^dog check for?
members.optionA: It checks that dog is not included in the user input
members.optionC: It checks that given user input ends with dog
members.solution: It checks that given user input begins with dog

members.prompt: What does the regex command [a-zA-Z0-9] check for?
members.optionA: It checks that given user input includes 1 alphabetic character
members.optionB: It checks that given user input ends with a number
members.optionC: It checks that given user input is not alphanumeric
members.solution: It checks that given user input is alphanumeric

members.prompt: What does the line userName = input() do?
members.optionA: It prints user input to the screen
members.optionB: It only accepts input but doesn't store it anywhere
members.optionC: It only creates a variable for input
members.solution: It takes in user input and stores it in the new variable UserName

members.prompt: What is CSS's main functionality?
members.optionA: CSS pairs with Python to build webpages
members.optionB: CSS helps to create function definitions
members.optionC: CSS pairs with JavaScript to create interactive webpages
members.solution: CSS pairs with HTML to add style and design choices

members.prompt: What does the line print('Nice to meet you') do?
members.optionC: It stores data about the user
members.solution: It prints the line within the parenthesis to the user's screen

members.prompt: In HTML, what are headings in arrow brackets < > called?
What is Javascript's main functionality?
members.optionC: It pairs with CSS to add style and design choices
members.solution: It pairs with HTML to create interactive webpages

members.prompt: what does the line: style type=''text/css'' do?
members.optionB: It styles the font of the CSS
members.solution: It tells the HTML that there will be upcoming stylistic CSS commands
